fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.design

Interface IListPage

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAuthenticatedPage, IDataPage, IThemedPage

    public interface IListPage
extends IDataPage, IAuthenticatedPage
    Provides data for a list page for an authenticated user, for navigating records.

    The default view can be adapted if necessary. In all cases, data needs to be fetched with paging.

    Thread-safety: implementations of this interface are not required to be safe for concurrent access. Therefore, processing should generally not be shared between multiple threads.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IListDesign, IDataViewService.getListViews(fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.auth.ITicket)

    • Method Detail

      • setPageContext

        void setPageContext(IListContext context)
             throws IllegalStateException
        Sets the context for page processing and rendering, after this page instance has been selected. This should only be called (at most) once per instance. If this instance is not selected (if overridden, or if used for constructing a page URI), then it might never be invoked.
        Parameters:
        context - the non-null context.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if invoked more than once.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getMasterListView

        IListView getMasterListView()
        Gets the master list view, the reference record type associated with this list page instance. Other lists may include associated ascending or descending lists (to implement a mosaic view).

        Customized variants (predefined customizations, or dynamically-modified variants of default filtering, sorting, and paging settings) are obtained using the adapt method.

        All style attributes and all attachment attributes are shared by all derived versions, enabling consistent navigation with arbitrary settings for filtering, sorting, and paging.

        Returns:
        the master list.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        adapt(IFilter, ISort, SortedSet, int, int), adapt(String, int), fetch()

      • adapt

        IListPage adapt(IFilter filter,
                ISort sort,
                SortedSet<ICell> displayableCells,
                int pageItemCount,
                int pageNumber)
        Gets a derived version of this list page, adapted with a filter, sort, and page size.

        All style attributes and all attachment attributes are inherited by the derived version.

        Parameters:
        filter - defines an alternative filter. If null, then the filter is inherited from the view from which this new list page will be derived. Note that during page processing, the filter defined here may be overridden.
        sort - defines alternative sorting rules. If null, then sorting rules are inherited from the view from which this new list page will be derived.
        displayableCells - the new set of displayable cells to use. If null, then the current set is implied. It is of no practical use to specify an empty set.
        pageItemCount - the number of items per page (defines the list's range relative to a page number, specified when fetching). The current count is obtained using getPageItemCount().
        pageNumber - the number of the page to fetch by default.
        Returns:
        the adapted instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if pageItemCount is less than one.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        adapt(String, int), fetch()

      • adapt

        IListPage adapt(String storedViewName,
                int pageNumber)
        Gets a derived version of this list page, adapted with a predefined named customization.

        All style attributes and all attachment attributes are inherited by the derived version.

        Parameters:
        storedViewName - the predefined name of the stored customization. Note that during page processing, the filter defined here may be overridden. If null, the current list view is implied.
        pageNumber - the number of the page to fetch by default.
        Returns:
        the derived adaptation of this list page.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the storedViewName does not exist, or if pageItemCount is less than one.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        adapt(IFilter, ISort, SortedSet, int, int), fetch(), IDataViewService.getStoredViews(IListView)

      • getPageItemCount

        int getPageItemCount()
        Gets the maximum number of items per page.

        This can be modified using the adapt(...) methods defined by this interface.

        Returns:
        the maximum number of items per page, in the range [1..Integer.MAX_VALUE].
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getPageNumber(), fetch(), IDataViewService.ITEMS_PER_PAGE

      • getPageNumber

        int getPageNumber()
        Gets the current page number.

        This can be modified using the adapt(...) methods defined by this interface.

        Returns:
        the current page number (1 by default).
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getPageItemCount()

      • fetch

        IList fetch()
     throws FetchException
        Fetches the list data. Data is selected using the current page's number and item count.

        When fetching, the beforeDataFilter and afterDataListFetch methods are invoked on registered page processors by default implementations of this interface.

        Returns:
        the list, never null.
        Throws:
        FetchException - if the list cannot be fetched.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        fetch(int)

      • fetch

        IList fetch(int pageNumber)
     throws FetchException
        Fetches the list with data, for the specified page (instead of using the default page number).

        This method variant is designed to simplify prefetching operations for back/forward navigation, and for "infinite scrolling" of lists. Note however that high volumes of page fetch requests may adversely affect performance.

        When fetching, the beforeDataFilter and afterDataListFetch methods are invoked on registered page processors by default implementations of this interface.

        Parameters:
        pageNumber - fetches the list with items in the range for the specified pageNumber.
        Returns:
        the list, never null.
        Throws:
        FetchException - if the list cannot be fetched.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        fetch()
